```{r setup, include=FALSE}
library(tidyverse)
library(broom)
```

## Problem 1
```{r}
bday = function(n) {

  bdays = sample(1:365, size = n, replace = TRUE)
  
  duplicate = length(unique(bdays)) < n

  return(duplicate)
  
}

bday_samp = 
  expand_grid(
    n = 2:50,
    iter = 1:10000
  ) |> 
  mutate(res = map_lgl(n, bday)) |> 
  group_by(n) |> 
  summarize(prob = mean(res))

bday_samp |>
  ggplot(aes(x = n, y = prob)) + 
  geom_line()
```

The probability that at least two people in the group will share a birthday increasing with group size. Around group size of 23, the probability exceeds 50%.


## Problem 2

```{r}
ttest = function(n = 30, sigma = 5, mu) {
  
  data = rnorm(n, mean = mu, sd = sigma)
  
  ttest_result = t.test(data, mu = 0) 
  
  tidy_result = broom::tidy(ttest_result)
  
  return(data.frame(mu_est = mean(data), p_value = tidy_result$p.value))
}

set.seed(123)
ttest_df  
  expand_grid(
    iter = 1:5000,
    mu = 0:6
  ) |> 
  mutate(res = map(mu, ttest)) |> 
  unnest(res) 
```
